author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request does not meet the guidelines for auto-merging. Please make sure that you have read the [General registry README](https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/blob/master/README.md) and the [AutoMerge guidelines](https://juliaregistries.github.io/RegistryCI.jl/stable/guidelines/). The following guidelines were not met:

- Name does not meet all of the following: starts with an upper-case letter, ASCII alphanumerics only, not all letters are upper-case.
- Name is not at least 5 characters long
- Package name similar to 10 existing packages.
  1. Similar to RoME. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2. Normalized visual distance 2.37 is at or below cutoff of 2.50.
  2. Similar to HAML. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  3. Similar to GAMS. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  4. Similar to YAML. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  5. Similar to ACME. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  6. Similar to FDM. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  7. Similar to XAM. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  8. Similar to FMI. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  9. Similar to AMD. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  10. Similar to ASE. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.

Note that the guidelines are only required for the pull request to be merged automatically. However, it is **strongly recommended** to follow them, since otherwise the pull request needs to be manually reviewed and merged by a human.

After you have fixed the AutoMerge issues, simple retrigger Registrator, which will automatically update this pull request. You do not need to change the version number in your `Project.toml` file (unless of course the AutoMerge issue is that you skipped a version number, in which case you should change the version number).

If you do not want to fix the AutoMerge issues, please post a comment explaining why you would like this pull request to be manually merged.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have also read the package naming guidelines: https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->

Hello!

This package is a Julia interface with the FAME database and analytics engine for storing and working with economic and financial time series. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FAME_(database). I hope you would agree that using the name FAME.jl is straight forward and makes a good sense for the users of the package.

Thank you,
Boyan

[noblock]

Side note, it'd be good if your package actually had tests, instead of an [empty set](https://github.com/bankofcanada/FAME.jl/blob/65a207beb7f4c1cb6f8a2324fe0d21d64f57d1c7/test/runtests.jl) which is even loading a module with the wrong name.  Also, documentation would be useful to let other people use your package.

[noblock]

> Side note, it'd be good if your package actually had tests, instead of an [empty set](https://github.com/bankofcanada/FAME.jl/blob/65a207beb7f4c1cb6f8a2324fe0d21d64f57d1c7/test/runtests.jl) which is even loading a module with the wrong name. Also, documentation would be useful to let other people use your package.
> 
> [noblock]

Thanks!  We'll fix the tests and we'll add documentation. It's work in progress.

[noblock]

@giordano Could you please merge this request when you have a chance?  Thanks for your help!

[noblock]

body:
- Registering package: FAME
- Repository: https://github.com/bankofcanada/FAME.jl
- Created by: @bbejanov
- Version: v0.1.0

- Git reference: HEAD
title: New package: FAME v0.1.0
